New Records: Griffin Conine hit the first home run of his big league career, with a 112.5 mph speed and 401 feet distance
Key Match Events: Griffin Conine hit a two-run blast in the top of the second inning
Connor Norby hit a solo shot in the sixth inning
David Hensley hit a groundout in the seventh inning that scored an insurance run
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Skip Schumaker emphasized that Griffin Conine is doing the most with his opportunity and taking advantage of it
Schumaker likes Conine's game, not just his power, but also his ability to make productive outs
Post-Match Reflections: Griffin Conine expressed his excitement and gratitude after hitting his first home run, saying it was a dream-like scenario
Conine's dad, Jeff Conine, was waiting for a text and a phone call from his son after the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Marlins were aware of Conine's potential for power, as he led Triple-A Jacksonville with 19 homers before getting his first call to the Majors
Through five Major League games, three of Conine's four hits have gone for extra bases
Others: The Marlins improved to 21-17 in one-run games, and the win helped Edward Cabrera bookend his solid August with winning decisions
